item.description:
I polled the attendees at our Brazilian See-Food dinner tonight to see what type of cuisine they'd most like to enjoy for a Boston Restaurant Week dinner and the hands-down favorite was. . . Indian! I was less than thrilled. I LOVE Indian food, but not Indian RESTAURANT food. It can't compare with authentic home-cooked Indian food and almost all Indian restaurants seem to have the same menu. Boring!

Then it occurred to me that Indian-INFLUENCED food is an entirely different kettle of fish. And I remembered that I have wanted to try the food at Mantra for a very long time. It combines exotic Indian spices with classic French cooking technique and New England-sourced ingredients. It also claims to be the only French-Indian restaurant in New England, not to mention "one of the most significant interior spaces in Boston in more than a decade," according to the Globe.

So we now have a reservation during Restaurant Week, and will be able to sample the special 3-course menu they are featuring for $33.10. Or sample any of the other delights available there, which include some very creative cocktails, a "naan bar," and a hookah room.

I hope you are as excited and intrigued as I am!

Reminder: If this is your first meetup with our group, you must pay a reservation fee in order to reserve your spot. Don't worry, you'll get it back, sort of . . . I will add it into the tax-and-tip part of the bill for our table.

item.name: Restaurant Week Dinner at Mantra, Boston
